Key Match Events: Kai Havertz scored a penalty in the 53rd minute.
Jamal Musiala scored in the 68th minute.
Julian Nagelsmann received a yellow card in the 59th minute.
Denmark's Hjulmand received a yellow card in the 41st minute.
Denmark's Andersen received a yellow card in the 57th minute.
Denmark's Maehle received a yellow card in the 60th minute.
Pre-Game Insights: Germany boss Julian Nagelsmann is at risk of being without both of his first-choice centre-backs for the match.
Jonathan Tah must serve a one-match ban due to his second yellow card in the competition.
Antonio Rudiger is struggling with a thigh injury but is expected to play.
Nico Schlotterbeck is expected to replace Jonathan Tah.
Waldemar Anton and Robin Koch are ready to deputise for Rudiger if required.
Joshua Kimmich and Maximilian Mittelstadt are undisputed starters in front of Manuel Neuer.
Robert Andrich and Toni Kroos are expected to start in midfield.
Ilkay Gundogan is expected to play further ahead in midfield.
Niclas Fullkrug's late leveller versus Switzerland took him up to two goals at Euro 2024.
Kai Havertz is expected to lead the line from the start, supported by Jamal Musiala and Florian Wirtz.
